txt.en: 'Let us meet with Mordrambor, [placeholder]. We have much to say to him... and to hear, I expect.\n\n'We will need to be on our guard. Let us learn from Laerdan's folly, and our own: even in captivity, a Black Númenórean may cause much trouble.'

'Mordrambor is gone, [placeholder], and he leaves many of my people dead or dying. It seems that he wove cruel sorceries within the mind of his jailor: how often did Tadan resolve to bring Tann Morgul to me, only to have the matter slip from his memory? It is clear that this relic of evil gave to our prisoner some measure of the power he sought.\n\n'Nay! Do not blame Tadan for this! Any of us could have done this. His was a dangerous duty, and he has come now to the end of his service. Weep for him, but do not lay the blame at his feet! It belongs with Angmar and its cruel servants alone.'
'We must repair the damage done to the keep, but there can be no cure for some of these hurts.'
'Tadan will be pleased to see us and to have a rest from watching the prisoner.'
Calenglad is inside the keep on Tinnudir.\n\nYou have entered the keep on Tinnudir to confront Mordrambor, the imprisoned Black Númenórean.
Calenglad is inside the keep on Tinnudir.\n\nYou and Calenglad have entered the keep on Tinnudir to confront Mordrambor, the imprisoned Black Númenórean.
Tadan is inside the room atop the stairs, where Mordrambor was being held prisoner.\n\nThe Black Númenórean has escaped from his prison, and there is no sign of his jailor.
'So perish all who oppose the might of Angmar!'
Calenglad is inside the keep on Tinnudir.\n\nMordrambor has escaped, and in his wake, he has left the dead and the dying.
'[placeholder], my friend! I hoped thou wouldst see my triumph!'
'Alas, I cannot deal with thee now as I have dealt with these others.'
'I will see thee again, [placeholder], and will become thy doom!'
Calenglad has decided to confront Mordrambor and learn if he knows anything about Narchuil.
'Mordrambor will learn it is unwise to trifle with the Dúnedain.'
'[placeholder]... it was Tann Morgul. I kept meaning to bring it... to Calenglad... but....\n\n'Mordrambor... his sorceries....'
